intro: Adenocalymma bipinnatum, commonly known as the two-pinnate adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its bipinnate leaves, which are divided into two sets of smaller leaflets, giving it a feathery appearance. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Adenocalymma bipinnatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
